Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of high doses of vitamin C in dramatically slowing or completely stopping the coronavirus pandemic.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence to support the claim that high doses of vitamin C can stop or treat the new coronavirus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient scientific evidence or support to substantiate its claim about the effectiveness of high doses of vitamin C in combating the coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C can have a significant impact on slowing or stopping the coronavirus pandemic without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
